seasons: 1952 – 1953 In 1949 and 1950, AFM participated in the German [[Formula 2]] championship. <!-- 4 entries, 4 starts -->

name: Alta
seasons: 1950 – 1952 From 1950 to 1957, Alta was also an engine manufacturer for teams [[Hersham and Walton Motors|HWM]], [[Cooper (car)|Cooper]] and [[Connaught Engineering|Connaught]]. <!-- 5 entries, 5 starts -->

name: Arrows Arrows were known as [[Footwork Arrows|Footwork]] from 1991 to 1996.
Automobili Turismo e Sport
seasons: 1963 In [[1964 Formula One season|1964]] and [[1967 Formula One season|1967]], ATS was an engine manufacturer for teams [[Derrington-Francis]] and [[Cooper Car Company|Cooper]], racing at the [[1964 Italian Grand Prix|1964 Italian]] and [[1967 British Grand Prix|1967 British]] Grands Prix with [[Mário de Araújo Cabral]] and [[Silvio Moser]].

name: British American Racing BAR formerly [[Tyrrell Racing|Tyrrell]]; subsequently became [[Honda in Formula One|Honda]], then [[Brawn GP|Brawn]], then [[Mercedes-Benz in Formula One|Mercedes]].
Benetton Benetton formerly [[Toleman]]; subsequently became [[Renault in Formula One|Renault]], then [[Lotus F1]] and again, [[Renault in Formula One|Renault]].
from: United Kingdom   / {{flag|Italy}} From {{F1|1986}} to {{F1|1995}} Benetton had a British licence; from {{F1|1996}} to {{F1|2001}}, an Italian one.

name: Coloni Coloni subsequently became [[Andrea Moda Formula|Andrea Moda]].
Force India Force India formerly [[Jordan Grand Prix|Jordan]], [[Midland F1 Racing|Midland]] and [[Spyker F1|Spyker]]; subsequently became [[Racing Point Force India]]. (Sahara)
seasons: 2008 – 2018 <!-- 191 entries, 191 starts as of the end of 2017 -->

name: Frank Williams Racing Cars Frank Williams Racing Cars includes [[Frank Williams Racing Cars#Politoys and the FX3|Politoys]] ({{F1|1972}}), [[Iso–Marlboro]] ({{F1|1973}}–{{F1|1974}}) and [[Wolf–Williams]] ({{F1|1976}}) cars. Prior to 1972 FWRC ran customer chassis. Subsequently became [[Walter Wolf Racing|Wolf]]. [[Williams Grand Prix Engineering]] was a new constructor established by Frank Williams and Patrick Head after Williams left Wolf–Williams. <!-- 61 entries, 56 starts -->
Jaguar Jaguar formerly [[Stewart Grand Prix]]. Subsequently became [[Red Bull Racing]].
Jordan Jordan subsequently became [[Midland F1 Racing]], then [[Spyker F1|Spyker]], then [[Force India]].
Leyton House Leyton House formerly [[March Engineering]].
Ligier Ligier subsequently became [[Prost Grand Prix]].
Lola Lola includes [[Larrousse]] ({{F1|1990}}) and [[Mastercard Lola]] ({{F1|1997}}) entries.
Manor
seasons: 2016 <!-- 21 entries, 21 starts as of the end of 2016 -->

name: March March subsequently became [[Leyton House Racing]], later reappearing as March for one final season.
Marussia Marussia formerly [[Virgin Racing]], subsequently became [[Manor Racing]].
Midland Midland formerly [[Jordan Grand Prix]]; subsequently became [[Spyker F1]], then [[Force India]].
Minardi Minardi subsequently became [[Scuderia Toro Rosso]], then [[Scuderia AlphaTauri|AlphaTauri]].

Racing Point Force India Racing Point Force India formerly [[Jordan Grand Prix|Jordan]], [[Midland F1 Racing|Midland]], [[Spyker F1|Spyker]] and [[Force India]]; subsequently became [[Racing Point F1 Team|Racing Point]].
Renault
from: France Renault had a British licence in {{F1|2011}}.

name: Sauber / BMW Sauber From 1993 to 2005 and from 2011 to 2018 as Sauber; from 2006 to 2010 as BMW Sauber; subsequently became [[Alfa Romeo in Formula One|Alfa Romeo]].
from: Switzerland   / {{flag|Germany}} From {{F1|1993}} to {{F1|2005}} and from {{F1|2010}} to {{F1|2018}} Sauber had a Swiss licence (in 2010 as BMW Sauber); from {{F1|2006}} to {{F1|2009}}, a German one (as BMW Sauber).

name: Shadow
from: United States   / {{flag|United Kingdom}} From {{F1|1973}} to {{F1|1975}} Shadow had an American licence; from {{F1|1976}} to {{F1|1980}}, a British one.

name: Spyker Spyker formerly [[Jordan Grand Prix]] and [[Midland F1 Racing]]; subsequently became [[Force India]].
Toro Rosso Scuderia Toro Rosso formerly [[Minardi]]; subsequently became [[Scuderia AlphaTauri|AlphaTauri]].
seasons: 2006 – 2019 <!-- 247 entries, 247 starts as of the end of 2018 -->

name: Tyrrell Tyrrell subsequently became [[British American Racing]].
Virgin Virgin subsequently became [[Marussia F1]], then [[Manor Racing]].
Wolf (Walter Wolf Racing) Wolf formerly [[Frank Williams Racing Cars]].
